arm_group.description: All participants had to run 20min on their individual anaerobic threshold

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim was to analyze the influence of fatigue on the dynamic postural control in one-leg
      standing and in jump landing, followed by stabilization or side jumps, and to compare
      athletes of different levels with control subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  competitive level (participation in any league) for the high performance athletes
             group

          -  participation in sport for 0.5-4 hours per week for the recreationally active
             subjects

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  current history of a lower extremity injury requiring training cessation on the day
             of testing

          -  neurological diseases

          -  vestibular or visual disturbances

          -  cardiovascular diseases medication affecting balance

facility.name: University Hospital, Department of Orthopedics, Trauma Surgery and Spinal Cord Injury

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of an Exercise on the Dynamic Postural Control in Athletes

primary_outcome.measure: Change of force ratio of ground reaction forces in/after landing from baseline
Change of the velocity of the center of pressure (COP) from baseline

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Specialist for Orthopedics and Trauma Surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of rate of perceived exertion (Borg Scale) from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 10 min during and 1, 5, 10, 15, 20 min after exercise

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
